pages.text: Here lies any sort of odd tool type that didn't fit in the makeshift or regular tools category, such as Rain Collectors, Ice Tongs, Shelves, and Clay Pots.

pages.title: Glowing Jelly Ball
pages.text: Throw these sticky blobs if you want to light up an area afar, or test the depths of a bottomless cave before diving in.

pages.title: Clay Pot
pages.text: A decent way of transporting water. Not as useful as an Iron Bucket, but you can carry more of these.

pages.title: Climbing Axe
pages.text: Used to scale up cliff sides and mountains. Don't look down!

pages.title: Shears
pages.text: For harvesting delicate plants, leaves, and wool.

pages.title: Ice Tongs
pages.text: Useful for harvesting lots of Ice without it melting or shattering to bits.

pages.title: Rock Hammer
pages.text: Used by Anthropologists and Crystal Miners alike to safely harvest fossils, geodes, ancient ruins, you name it!

pages.title: Flint and Steel
pages.text: For quickly lighting fires.

pages.title: Fishing Rod
pages.text: A nice way to relax- unless you have poor luck and end up fishing up junk all day.

pages.title: Rope Ladder
pages.text: A cheap but effective ladder.

pages.title: Ladder
pages.text: Cheap to produce, but too weak to stand on its own.

pages.title: Plank Ladder
pages.text: Great for climbing and it can stand on it's own.

pages.title: Bamboo Ladder
pages.text: Good for climbing, renewable, and it can stand on it's own.

pages.title: Metal Ladders
pages.text: Great for climbing, and it's more damage/blast resistant than a regular ladder.

pages.title: Rope Bridge Anchor
pages.text: It's best to secure your Rope Bridges to these.

pages.title: Rope Bridge
pages.text: For traversing large gaps such as ravines.

pages.title: Name Tag
pages.text: A simple way of naming your pets.

pages.title: Saddle
pages.text: If you plan to travel on horse-back, these are a necessity.

pages.title: Horse Armor
pages.text: Decent for protecting your noble steed.

pages.title: Rain Collector
pages.text: Rain water tastes better than from a well in my opinion.

pages.title: Water Strainer
pages.text: Protects the oceans, and gets you free junk. Best thing ever.

pages.title: Barrel Planter
pages.text: Great for growing some plants indoors without getting dirt everywhere.

pages.title: Flower Pot
pages.text: Great for decorative plants kept indoors, aside from crops.

pages.title: Scaffolding
pages.text: Useful when building larger structures.

pages.title: Sprinkler
pages.text: Great for watering large areas!
